Package pt.up.fe.specs.tupatcher

Class TUPatcherUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.up.fe.specs.tupatcher.TUPatcherUtils
  • public class TUPatcherUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Functions to help extract information from error messages and source code.
    Author:
    Pedro Galvao

      • readWhile

        public static TUPatcherUtils.StringInt readWhile​(java.lang.String source,
                                                 int startIndex,
                                                 TUPatcherUtils.CharFunction condition,
                                                 boolean forward)
        Read source code while the condition is true

        Parameters:
        forward - : true to read forward, false to read backwards.
        Returns:
        String with the code read and int indicating position in source where it stopped reading.

        Get the token in a given location of source code.

      • getTokenBeforeLocation

        public static java.lang.String getTokenBeforeLocation​(java.lang.String location)
        Same as the function getTokenFromLocation, but assuming that the location indicates some character after the beginning of the token.

      • isFunctionCall

        public static boolean isFunctionCall​(java.lang.String location)

        Get number of arguments in a function call.

      • getArguments

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getArguments​(java.lang.String location)
        Get names of variables used as arguments in a function call.

      • getTypeFromDeclaration

        public static java.lang.String getTypeFromDeclaration​(java.lang.String location)
        Find the type name in a variable declaration.

      • getTypeFromStructDeclaration

        public static java.lang.String getTypeFromStructDeclaration​(java.lang.String location)
        Find struct name in a declaration

        This function should be used when a variable is declared in the following format (or something similar): struct foo bar = {0, 1, 2}; This function only works if the initialization uses curly brackets.

      • extractFromParenthesis

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> extractFromParenthesis​(java.lang.String message)
        Extract substrings between parenthesis from error messages

      • extractFromSingleQuotes

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> extractFromSingleQuotes​(java.lang.String message)
        Extract substrings between single quotes from error messages

      • getTypesFromMessage

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getTypesFromMessage​(java.lang.String message)
        Extract type names from error messages

      • getAkaFromMessage

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAkaFromMessage​(java.lang.String message)
        Extract "aka" from error messages (if there is any)

        Example: "member reference base type 'TYPE_PATCH_1872' (aka 'int') is not a structure or union" -> "int" When no "aka" is found for the type, it returns an empty string. The result is always an ArrayList with size=2.

      • removeBracketsFromType

        public static java.lang.String removeBracketsFromType​(java.lang.String typeName)
        remove brackets and substitute with * Example: char[3] -> char*

      • getTypeName

        public static java.lang.String getTypeName​(java.lang.String qualtype)
        Takes as argument a type with qualifiers and returns the type name without the qualifiers. Example: const foo * -> foo

      • extractOperator

        public static java.lang.String extractOperator​(java.lang.String source)
        Takes as argument a fragment of source code and detects which operator is found in the first characters.

      • hasArrowOrDot

        public static boolean hasArrowOrDot​(java.lang.String location)
        Identify if an arrow or dot is used after the identifier in the location.

      • usingOperator

        public static boolean usingOperator​(java.lang.String location)
        Identify if the token in a given location in source code has an operator after it.

        This function is useful to check if the identifier is the name of a variable. Example: foo += bar;

      • isCast

        public static boolean isCast​(java.lang.String location)
        Identify if the token in a given location in source code is used to cast a variable.

        This function is useful to check if the identifier is the name of a type (not a variable or function). Example: x = (Foo *)y;

      • isVariable

        public static boolean isVariable​(java.lang.String location)
        Check if the identifier in the given location is a variable.
        Parameters:
        location -
        Returns:
        true if it is possible to assure that the identifier is a variable, false otherwise.

      • isPrimitiveType

        public static boolean isPrimitiveType​(java.lang.String type)

        Remove all line and block comments in source code.
        Parameters:
        source -
        Returns:
